The D field offset is 0.1 V/nm.
This is from 1+2, because positive D in the electron side and negative D in the hole side will push the carrier to the top interface (should be moire interface)
This is from 2+1

The same scan as before but the spectra are very different
Consistent with RMCD polarized after n = -3e12 cm-2

Kink at -1

Twisted trilayer part, optimized position, polarization resolved reflectance measurement, B = 0 T, D = 0.1 V/nm
Except integer state, can see fractional states, though not polarized

Twisted trilayer part, optimized position, polarization resolved reflectance measurement, B = 0 T, D = 0.035V/nm
The same doping at the same D as bilayer, but very different response.
The magnetism is weaker, consistent with FM is strongest at D =0.1 V/nm

Twisted trilayer part, optimized position, polarization resolved reflectance measurement, B = 0 T, D = 0.035V/nm
Previous scans are positive B initialized, now initialized at negative B
Positive B initialized
Opposite response stable hysteresis, no flip

Twisted trilayer part, optimized position, polarization resolved D dep, B = 0 T, n = -3.4 e12 cm^-2
Negative B initialized
Consistent, only near 0.1 V/nm, there is FM

Twisted trilayer part, optimized position, polarization resolved D dep, B = 0 T, n = -3.4 e12 cm^-2
Positive B initialized
Consistent, only near 0.1 V/nm, there is FM

Reflectance spatial map, Vtg = Vbg = 0, exc linear, coll L
tML/BL
tML/ML
tML/ML
Consistent FM at finite D
Can see -2/3 fractional state

Current understanding
(1) The zero B FM is at tA/AB (higher energy resonance), and finite B weak magnetism is at tAB/A (lower energy resonance)
Explanation: based on previous measurements, E (tA/B)<E(tA/A)< E (natural AB), so tA/A interface is the lowest energy part in tA/AB, and tB/A is the lowest energy interface in tAB/A. Since E (tA/A)> E(tB/A), the tML/BL should be tA/AB and tBL/ML should be tAB/A.
The zero B FM at tA/AB (tML/BL) is at D = 0.1 V/nm, which is pointing from ML to BL, the offset is different from tA/A/A (1+1+1) structure (0.25-0.3 V/nm).
Explanation: the hybridization in tA/AB is weaker than tA/A/A. The different part is the D offset. D>0 at tA/AB is to push holes from ML to BL, which is effectively tBA/AB, where as tA/A/A is to push the holes to tA/A interface, effectively tA/A. The extend wing feature at tA/AB is at negative D, which is tA/A interface.
tA/AB
tA/A/A

wavelength
Try here
Finally, finally, get the ferromagnetism in 1+2 layer sample!!!
RMCD wing feature only appear at negative D field, exactly opposite to the 2+1 layer at finite D!
Negative D will push the hole to the top interface (tA/AB), which is the moiré interface.
There is also a large D offset (100 mV/nm) as XD expected.

Spot3, tA/AB fine D dep B sweeps, 100 nW, 1126 nm, n = -3.3e12 cm^-2
Very asymmetric
Moiré proximity
Moiré distant
Very different hysteresis behavior
Moiré proximity:  the magnitude and loop size decrease simultaneously.
Moiré distant: the loop size decrease much faster than the magnitude
